abstract: Joe Nocera Sports Business column discusses class-action lawsuit filed by members of Trump-owned golf resort against Donald J Trump claiming he reneged on deal to pay them their refundable deposits, many of which were in range of $200,000; Trump, who purchased Marriott Vacations Worldwide resort for $5 million in 2012 and later renamed Trump National Jupiter, had originally agreed to assume $30 million in debt resulting from members’ refundable deposits.

headline.print_headline: Golfers Say Trump Reneged on Deal
headline.main: Golfers Say Trump Reneged on Deal

snippet: Members of Trump National Jupiter say that Donald J. Trump basically stiffed them out of their refundable deposits, causing them to negotiate settlements or sue.
lead_paragraph: Members of Trump National Jupiter say that Donald J. Trump basically stiffed them out of their refundable deposits, causing them to negotiate settlements or sue.
